text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen a few 
times a year my grandmother would make what

we call worship chickens and they're basically 
whole poached chickens that we use in different

ceremonies throughout the year when the ceremony 
is done we end up with a whole poached chicken

so she would cut it up and turn it into 
what's called gai kem or literally salty

chicken that's what I'm going to make today 
without the whole worship chicken bit let's

get started obviously I am not starting with a 
worship chicken but I am starting with chicken

thigh which I have cut into about an inch cube 
I recommend using chicken thigh for this because

of the end there's not going to be any sauce or 
anything around it so if you use chicken breast

it can feel quite dry but the chicken thigh is 
lots of fat it's juicy it's just going to be

better trust me and it's so simple I've got some 
soy sauce some golden mountain sauce is just a

different kind of soy sauce with a different 
flavor you can just use extra soy sauce and

to get some dark delicious color going black soy 
sauce it's got a little bit of molasses in it so

it's not very salty it's a little sweet but more 
importantly this is going to make the color dark

appetizing and the bottle looks like that now 
you can use other brands of dark soy sauce as

well that will help with the color but those 
are generally a little saltier than this one

so you may need a little less now I'm going to 
let this sit for about 15-20 minutes during this

time you can chop your garlic and chop your 
ginger and all that and then we're going to

get cooking so got a walk here a large saute pan 
would work some vegetable oil I'm going to go in

with some garlic you cannot have too much garlic 
for this and ginger let the garlic and the ginger

flavor the oil so that then the oil can coat 
everything else and flavor everything else this

is going to be so simple once some of the garlic 
starts to turn golden go in with the chicken

and just keep tossing until the chicken 
is almost done we don't need to add any

liquid this is a dry dish I want all that 
seasoning to go in and around the chicken

nothing pulling on the outside so now the 
outside of the chickens done just a little

bit before the inside is side I'm going 
to add the sugar palm sugar I want that

butterscotch flavor and some white pepper a 
lot of pepper is okay black pepper is okay as

well now just want the sugar to dissolve and 
I'm adding this sugar at the end so that the

sugar doesn't burn if I added in the beginning 
sometimes it can get stuck to the edges and bird

yeah that's looking good turn it off throw 
in some cilantro for some extra freshness

lots of cilantro make sure you use the stem to 
swell okay now that looks and smells amazing

if you like the spicy flavor of fresh ginger 
you can put some fresh julienne ginger on top

as a garnish and edible garnish I need some 
rice always have this with rice hmm this

makes me miss my grandmother when she makes it 
it's a little bit different but she starts out

with already cooked chicken but the flavor is 
still the same salty a little sweet garlicky

and that subtle heat from the ginger but 
it's such simple goodness so I hope you

give this a try and when you do let me know 
how it goes Facebook Twitter Instagram send

me some photos the recipe as always a lot huh 
Thai Kitchen Tom and I will see you next time

for your next delicious Thai nice I am NOT 
starting with supersu where she chooses now

if your breast person I recommend using five 
and you we don't ask we don't need Oh smarter
